title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions: Western Digital Corp

content.text: Year 2000: Western Digital Corp undergoes a 2-for-1 stock split.
Year 2005: Another 2-for-1 stock split occurs for Western Digital Corp.
Year 2018: Western Digital Corp implements a 5-for-1 reverse stock split.
Year 2003: Western Digital Corp acquires the hard drive business of Read-Rite Corporation.
Year 2009: Western Digital Corp merges with Fujitsu's hard drive business, expanding its market share.
Year 2011: Western Digital Corp acquires Hitachi Global Storage Technologies, solidifying its position as a leading storage solutions provider.
Year 2016: Western Digital Corp enters into a joint venture with Unisplendour Corporation Limited, forming Unis-WDC Storage Technology Company Limited.
Year 2018: Western Digital Corp announces a quarterly cash dividend of $0.50 per share.
